newsitem.title: USA: FERC commissioner Santa to quit in June.
newsitem.headline: FERC commissioner Santa to quit in June.

text.p: Donald Santa, one of five commissioners on the U.S. Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, Wednesday told the White House he wanted to quit his job when his term expires June 30.
"After much thought, I concluded that with the upcoming expiration of my term, it is an appropriate time to explore opportunities outside the Commission," he said in a statement.
Santa, 38, was named as an independent to the commission from the Senate Energy Committee four years ago by President Bill Clinton.
No more than three out of the FERC's five commissioners may be from the same political party. Santa's departure would leave the commission with three Democrats and one Republican.
"Don played a critically important role in developing and implementing major policy changes in both the natural gas and electric industries," said FERC chairwoman Elizabeth Moler.
"Had Don chosen to seek reappointment, I would have been a very vigorous supporter," she said in a statement.
Santa said he had no future plans yet but expected to remain in the energy field.
